info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 9:22AM PST by NWS Hanford CA
info.description:
At 922 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles northeast of Merced to near Madera Acres. Movement was north at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Chowchilla, Bootjack, Mariposa, Catheys Valley, Metcalf Gap, Jerseydale, Ahwahnee, and Le Grand.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN MARIPOSA...WEST CENTRAL MADERA AND NORTHEASTERN MERCED COUNTIES THROUGH 945 AM PST

area.areaDesc: Merced - Madera - Mendota; Planada - Le Grand - Snelling; Mariposa Madera Foothills; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra
